personalInfo.name: Jay Gandhi
personalInfo.headline: Building Impactful Solutions, One Commit at a Time.
personalInfo.tagline: Fusing robust, production-ready Java & Python engineering with cutting-edge Generative AI, ML and NLP
personalInfo.aboutMe: My journey in software engineering has been driven by a relentless curiosity in how intelligent systems can solve complex, real-world problems. As a Research Engineer at TCS Research, I thrive at the intersection of theory and application, passionate about designing scalable systems and translating novel Machine Learning and NLP models into deployable products. My core focus includes Java, Python, Generative AI, and Microservices architecture. My commitment is to continuous learning and delivering high-quality, impactful software.

workProjects.name: Automated Monolith to Microservices Decomposition Tool
workProjects.description: Led research and innovation to design an automated workflow for decomposing monoliths into domain-aligned microservices. The solution applied Graph Clustering algorithms (Markov, Louvain) on large legacy code base graphs (>5 Million Lines of Code) to identify service boundaries and integrated LLMs for semantic code summarization, reducing manual analysis time by 80% and domain mapping effort by 70%. Contributed to frontend integration React when needed to support end-to-end delivery.
workProjects.myRole: Research Engineer and Full Stack Developer

personalProjects.name: AI-Driven Microservices Refactoring API
personalProjects.description: Developed a production-ready tool from scratch to operationalize the research, exposing a robust REST API for consumption and integrating a ReactJS UI. Focused on creating a tool that can be deployed to internal business units, collecting feedback from 7 stakeholders for production readiness and usability improvements.

personalProjects.name: Domain Aligned Microservices Boundary Identification
personalProjects.description: My research work focused specifically on the core challenge of accurately identifying service and domain boundaries within complex enterprise applications using novel AI/ML techniques. This resulted in improved decomposition quality and the foundation for the automated tool. This work led to an ACM paper and a filed patent.

experience.achievement: Led a project initiavtive to design and develope an automated monolith to microservices decomposition system from scratch, reducing manual architecture refactoring efforts by 80% and resulting in 2 research papers published at well-established venues and 1 filed patent. (Refer to 'Projects' section for more details)
